result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha Ann Mallon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Cases called: 15CM628 & 15CM491, Defendant Samantha Ann Mallon in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2 in 15CM628. and Cts. 1&2 in 15CM491. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence in 15CM628 is $579 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. (ct. 1 read in and dismissed.)   In 15CM491, $543 costs on ct. 1, $473.50 fine on ct. 2, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. (Ct. 3 read in and dismissed). 15CM491, 1 day jail credit. 15CM628, 2 days jail credit.

Defendant Samantha Ann Mallon in court, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Dolch requesting new dates,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Discovery letter filed to Atty Dolch.   Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by  DA Jane Kohlwey
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by  DA Jane Kohlwey
with Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. No violent contact with M.B.

Defendant, Samantha Ann Mallon, appeared in custody with Atty. Amanda Riek of the public defender's office. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.$1,000 recog. bond with Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. No violent contact with M.B.
